duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage sourcing activities for hardware, software, telecom, data center, and professional services including network hardware (e.g., routing, switching, NICs, etc)
Lead and coordinate all procurement efforts to identify, survey, audit, assess and qualify new suppliers.
Lead the business negotiation process with external suppliers. Own contract initiation and closure.
Develop a comprehensive procurement strategy focused on the network hardware ecosystem: hardware, service, licensing, support.
Own and lead the supplier interface for all RFI, RFP and RFQ services. Partner with appropriate internal teams.
Identify key benchmark suppliers in RFx efforts. Partner to identify evaluation criteria and provide relevant data back to internal team.
Continuously measure and improve supplier actual performance against mutually agreed SLA.
Ensure best in class pricing and terms are secured for equipment and services. Build should-cost models when appropriate.
Identify, qualify, and formalize which suppliers are on FTG's preferred supplier list. Ensure internal partner alignment.

Lead business review process to measure, analyze and identify points of strength and weakness with regards to supplier performance. Issue supplier corrective action requests and development plans, as needed.
Be the sourcing subject matter authority helping to identify and demonstrate best practices in the realms of procurement, supplier management and category management.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or related field (Master's preferred)
